page.title: 07EVENTS
page.content: {H.M.S. Warwick Remembered.} In 1984 some 60 surviving crew members plus more than 100 representing families who died in H.M.S. Warwick assembled for a reunion. This included a Remembrance Service at St. Merryn Parish Church, and dinner at the Harlyn Inn. Padstow Lifeboat (from Trevose Head) helped visitors to lay wreaths on the sea in memory of those who died when H.M.S. Warwick was sunk by enemy action off Trevose Head in l944. {RNLI LIFEBOAT "JAMES BURROUGH" } In April 1985 was held at Padstow the naming ceremony for the new Lifeboat that had been presented at a cost of approximately Â£500,000 by Miss H.B. Allen of Guildford. In l984 a cliff- face casualty lift from the Lifeboat House below was formally opened. The Lifeboat House is at Trevose Head.
